Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Good location. Friendly staff. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Average, clean and new but noisy”
Reviews.Author: AGall0
Reviews.Content: Regular room, not too small and with good new furniture, flat panel TV and stereo music equipment. The bathroom is also good enough and brand new, if not for the marble shelf over the sink, which steps out too much and you just risk of smashing your forehead when bending to clean your teeth or wash your mouth so be careful! The hotel is 5min walk from the main bus stop and 10min from the metro station so perfect for visiting or - as in my case - going to the Fira by bus in a very easy way. You can buy your ticket directly on the bus in cash. The hotel offers a good buffet breakfast while for dinner you can go to the restaurant just on the other side of the street. The biggest problem is that the room and especially the windows are not sound proof. The first night I could hear my neighbor snore so loud that I could not sleep and you even here voices of people speaking down in the street in spite of being at 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location.”
Reviews.Author: CrisPaun
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, just 10 min away from the metro station and 5 min from the tourist bus. If you take the tourist bus from this station it is not crowded and you can find a good seat upstairs. We came in Barcelona for two times and both times we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Just a comment”
Reviews.Author: Darren G
Reviews.Content: I have been looking through hotels in Barcelona for the last hour or so and I would like to say that it is very comforting to see a general manager, Mr. Gomez, that actually takes the time to give feedback on the comments posted. This makes it a bit easier to make a decision when someone puts the extra time in making their guests feel like they appreciated. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Good looking hotel...not so great location...”
Reviews.Author: Vanesa L
Reviews.Content: You may save some money on the hotel and stay in a nice hotel, but you'll be paying for convenience- either by wasting time walking to the metro, taking the bus, or paying for a cab to and from the sites. This was probably the nicest hotel we stayed at during our stay in Europe, but we all agreed we wouldn't do it again because we wasted our precious time and money on cabs and waiting for public transportation. This hotel was quite nice with a small fridge, which was great because we were able to go to the store and make our lunches and breakfasts (this hotel did not provide breakfast). There are many restaurants walking distance, including the grocery store. Barcelona is a gorgeous city with much to see and do...I just wish I knew exactly how far this hotel was from all the different sites. I would've chosen a closer spot- even if I had to sacrifice on aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but very noicy”
Reviews.Author: Sonja B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very close to our office, for that reason the location is perfect for us. The staff was always friendly. My room was tidy and neat. Only bad thing to mention is the noiciness os the room. There was a group of French students who were running around, talking, knocking on doors and drinking inside their room. Having my room next door, I could even understand every word of their conversation, Not to mention the other noices.

Reviews.Title: “Alls well that ends well!”
Reviews.Author: simon r
Reviews.Content: After a disasterous start. Following a brief chat withe the charming Senora La Directoria, we settled down to a wonderfull stay in our suites. As usual the the staff were charming and helpfull. We have been visiting this hotel for years and consider it the finest in Barcelona - we have tried other hotels in the Derby Group- We love its old world charm. A real Gem of a hotel. Simon Rudge and David Howitt

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: newchronos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a long walk from the main train station as well as being far away from the metro. The metro is about a 15 min walk and the main train station is around 30 min. The hotel room is very clean and modern with a decent size bathroom. We didn't eat in the hotel for there are numerous restuarants nearby. There is a bakery around the corner that serves amazing chocalate croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Melissa J
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no insulation apparently. And a group of people had no respect for anyone else on a Wednesday evening until 0230. We had to call the front desk twice in an hour and a half...but it did not matter, it was so loud. I will never stay again. I don't blame the hotel so much, but if you need some rest, as we did (I was having surgery the next day), don't bother booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit far from metro”
Reviews.Author: TravelNeed68
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, I'm not sure if I'd call it 4 star though. Free wifi throughout the hotel was great!!! Bathroom was a bit worn. Close to Diagonal but a 15 minute walk to the metro. Good breakfast included with our room. Neighborhood was fine but did have some girlie bars that opened at night. They weren't too bothersome though. Overall good hotel if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great in Many many Respects”
Reviews.Author: Roxcris
Reviews.Content: Went with a package so very good price. Was expecting a decent hotel, but it turned out to be excellent. Staff very very nice, polite, helpful, but never crossing any lines. Hallway absolutely new, the AC was perfect, really powerful and always working. They were cleaning, actually cleaning our room every morning, changing sheets and towels - as clean as you could possibly want a hotel room to be. Room was quite spacious, huge closet to put clothes in, safe which was perfectly "safe". Breakfast wasn't included and it was rather expensive - 10 euros so we didn't try it. Some good places to eat nearby - especially liked the pattisserie at Master of Fornet or something, dunno the name was in Catalan, very nearby. El Fornet is also affordable, but really average in quality. Anyways, pattisserie is definitely not something they know how to prepare in Barcelona. The view from the room was nothing lovely, but nothing unpleasant, just some funny sets of flats from nearby blocks, all with green drapes. The Bathroom is big, it even had a bidet, they provided us with soap, shampoo, just one pair of slippers and even body milk. The towels were so clean you had no problem using them, no worries whatsoever. No noise in our room, really, really quiet. The fridge was somewhat smallish but we managed. They also have their own cafe down the street - the coffee is really good. The coffee is generally EXCELLENT in Barcelona. Would really recommend it, especially if you can get a better price than the standard. Oh, and it's tops one hour walking, if you are not hurrying, from City Centre. The area is perfect, really quiet, no issues, had no problem walking down Loreto Street at midnight. The simplest way to reach the metro is to Hospital Clinic. Entenca is not nearer, neither farther, it is however more complicated to reach and the streets are not as nice as the ones taking you to Hospital Clinic, the metro station (Hosp. Clin.) is much nicer in appearance also. Great metro system, though not quite cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A good surprise”
Reviews.Author: Andriana1001
Reviews.Content: A good location if you want to see much more places of Barcelona. Not so close to the noisy center, but its a pleasant trip with all the transports if you want to see the city. Nice and safe neighborhood. A park next to the hotel. A 2 minutes walk to the main road and a 3-5 minutes walk to the bus stop. Rooms are clean with a very good room service watching our needs. We loved the breakfast. The staff was helpful, but they didn't speak english very well.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, out of the centre but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: rebecca w
Reviews.Content: Hotel Derby is a very quiet hotel, which is a positive as we had no noise from the streets or within the hotel itself. The nearest metro station is a 10 minute stroll away and from there only 2 or 3 stops to get you to the main station and famous land marks such as La Rambla. This means that the prices in cafes/bars/restaurants are not too high due to the location been away from the main attractions. There are a few restaurants nearby including well known chains of starbucks, kfc and subway within a 5 minute walk. The hotel is a good 3 star, but not a 4 star. There is a cafe/bar next door and a computer in reception for internet access, but that is all the facilities that are available. Rooms are small, but clean and room service is good. Breakfast is ok. Checking in and out only took 5 minutes and staff were helpful. I would go back but would try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShadyHany
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Derby with my wife for a week in lovely Barcelona and just returned couple of days ago. The hotel was great generally, I'll share below my experience: The arrival to the hotel wasn't very easy because all the types of transportation that I knew before travelling was either go to Sants station by train from Terminal 2 in the airport and walk for not less than 20 minutes to the hotel, or from Sants take the metro to Hospital Clinic station which is also 15 - 20 minutes walk, or last option would be taking Aerobus to Plaza Espanya or Plaza Catalunya and take anything to the hotel (which I didn't know). I chose taking the metro to Hospital Clinic, but still it was a bit tiring to walk for 20 minutes with your luggage, yet the location of the hotel is easy to find, you'll find it on the map clearly. After spending the week in Barcelona I figured out that there were easier ways to reach the hotel than the above ways: 1- Take the Aerobus from the airport (ticket 5.30 EUR) to Plaza Espanya and either take a taxi (around 10 EUR with your luggage) or take a bus from Plaza Espanya that goes to Josep Taradellas street, and ask the driver about the nearest station (I can't remember the name) 2- Take the train from Terminal 2 at the airport to Sants Station and from there take a taxi or a bus that goes to Josep Taradellas street Checking in was seamless, it took us only 15 minutes and the guy at the reception assigned us a smoking room in the only smoking floor (second floor) First impression on the room was that it was too small and very clean, but actually we didn't face a problem with the size of the room after putting our luggage away from the passage in the room. Bed was too small, I guess it was smaller than a queen size bed. Bathroom was very good and spacious. The room had a small TV with very bad location in the room not viewable easily from the bed, but who will need a TV while staying in Barcelona? View was very bad from the room, so actually we didn't pull the curtains across our entire stay. Room had a safety box, and free WiFi which worked fine. Sometimes I could hear other people talking in the rooms next to me, but that was very occasionally. Rooms were cleaned daily, and toileteers were provided and towels were changed. So room service was very good. Staff in the reception were more than helpful, they were not bored from tourist's too many question, always helped in directions and recommended attractions, city map was always available with them to explain to you all what you need. Breakfast was ok, for me it wasn't superb as I don't eat pork so my options were few, yet all food tasted really good. Location of the hotel is in a quite area, very close to several bus stops that can take you anywhere in the city, journey to Plaza Espanya is 10 minutes, to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas 15 - 20 minutes, but as I said it's not very near to a metro station so you better rely on buses for your transportations. There are many bars, cafe's and supermarkets around the hotel. On your way back with the bus it's a 5 minutes walk to the hotel, and even if you'll catch the night buses they stop in a very close bus stop around 5 mintes walk as well. So generally I liked the hotel a lot, but for me I would prefer if I stayed in a closer hotel to a metro station to avoid the busy streets during the buses journey.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad room.”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoFogg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite high level (deserves 4 stars). Good service, attention to customer's needs, good laundry service and VERY GOOD BREAKFAST. Unfortunately the room they gave me was very small, quite noisy and with an awful view. Area is OK, residential but a little bit out of the center.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location!”
Reviews.Author: Powersmurf
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel during our 3 day trip to Barcelona. The hotel is located in a great spot, only a 5 or 10 minute bus ride to down town. The rooms are small, but very comfortable and clean. The only bad thing I would say is that the rooms had a strange smell when we first walked in, it never went away??? Anyhow, staff were friendly, the restaurants nearby were good, so no complaints at all. Like others, I would say that this hotel is more 3 star. All in all, good hotel, good location!

Reviews.Title: “In the Derby I was first past the post”
Reviews.Author: Epicuruean
Reviews.Content: Having travelled with Ryan Air, we caught a train from the airport to Sants station, down town in Barcelona. The hotel is a few blocks from the station, which was 10 minutes walk leaving or 10 euro in a taxi, on arrival because it was late. The hotel is clean, tidy and pleasant. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was continental and hot tea impossible. The metro is not too far a walk away but you need to change lines to get to the real city centre. The tour bus provided a great means of seeing all the attractions at 30 euro for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, simple hotel in safe, quiet area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: nablu2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Derby Hotel in March 2011. To get there from public transport wasn't very easy but we got the train from the airport to Sants Station and walked - if you wish to get there this way we would recommend printing off a map. The walk takes about 15-20 minutes. The closest metro was Entenca which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The walk is pretty safe and we felt comfortable walking back from the station at night (11pm) The hotel is more of a UK 3 Star standard and is perfectly nice for a short break. We appeared to be the youngest people/couple there. Most other guests were families or older couples. The bedroom was good - smaller than expected but it had a good bath and shower. There was also a free safe which was great and a mini bar that has room for your personal drinks purchases. I'm dubious as to whether the rooms are as sound proofed as claimed as we wanted a siesta about 2 -4pm and the noise from the hotel staff cleaning other rooms was incredibly loud. We could hear their conversations and clattering in the corridor. They were very good at changing the sheets everyday (if requested) and providing new towels if needed. The bed was comfortable and we loved the pillows too! It's a shame that there was no tea and coffee making facility which would have made the room that little bit better. Around the hotel there are a few restaurants and tapas bars - I'd advise you to walk around the area as it is quite pretty and you can stumble upon some reasonably priced eating venues. This was particularly great for when we were too tired to take the metro to go into town for dinner and instead decided to explore the area around the hotel. Breakfast was good. However it seemed that the kitchen was understaffed, there was only one woman serving so don't be surprised if it takes about 20 mins before you're asked if you would like a tea or coffee. Also note that tea seems a strange request. The woman was happy to provide refills of coffee but for those who like tea, one small pot is given and you'd have to specifically request another as she will not just automatically offer you more for some reason. Not to mention, the kitchen staff are not very friendly or at all quick at assisting you for anything extra you may need. Furthermore, the "hot" buffet breakfast that apparently consists of eggs made to your choice, bacon and sausages is also never offered. There is a "menu" on each table that states the breakfast, however to have the hot breakfast I imagine you have to stop the waitress and ask her as it was never just automatically offered. It was quite confusing - we're still not sure if you either have the hot buffet breakfast or the cold buffet breakfast consisting of ham, cheese, fruit and breads - and you may not be allowed both. On our last day we asked for a boiled egg, which we got ... if not a good 25 minutes later. The reception staff were really fantastic and friendly. We forgot a few random things and asked if they had them - without hesitation they very professionally went and found the items for us - thank you! They were also multilingual. As it was my partner's birthday I had been in contact with the hotel prior to our visit and asked if there was anything little that they could add as a complimentary birthday treat - as has often been offered at other hotels I have stayed at for special occasions. I was informed in an email that as it was his birthday they would give us a "special room". This was definitely not the case. Especially because as soon as we arrived they asked us if we wanted two single beds or a double - so they obviously were not too prepared for our stay despite emailing beforehand. In conclusion, I would recommend this hotel for a nice short break and also if you don't mind being little far away from the tourist attractions - having said that, it only takes just over half an hour to get to the beach (with one change on the metro) so as long as you don't mind not having Barcelona on your doorstep, this is a very good choice for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: dawn1410London
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel, with clean rooms and everything necessary for a nice trip. Especially if you're keeping to a budget and don't need utter luxury, this is a great choice. We didn't eat breakfast, so can't comment. Location is great, it will take roughly 45 mins to walk into the Barri Gotic, but I think public transport is good (we choose to walk it). The tourist bus stops right outside and you can hop on the route to see the main sites. The area is full of upmarket shops and nice restaurants. We didn't actually eat out in the old town, but many restaurants there looked like real tourist traps, whereas the area round the hotel is less touristy. The little taberna opposite was especially friendly despite our lack of any real Spanish and their lack of English we really enjoyed a few pre-dinner drinks there. A good choice for a nice stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Amesthyite
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for holidays 1 week in July 2010. We travelled with our car, solution that we would think twice about in the future if we didn't absolutely want to take as much gear as we did. This because parking is very expensive, impossible to find in town so the hotel charges 18 Euros per day. Driving in town is also very dangerous until you understand that you have to push people out of the way with your bumper if you want to go anywhere. The hotel is located out of the center, in a very nice, calm and safe neighborhood, right beside one of the main stops of the Tourist Bus line - a very cheap way of visiting Barcelona as local busses and metro can end up costing a lot more depending if you want to visit or spend you time at the beach. There are many take-away food places at walking distance from the hotel (less than 10 minutes). Rooms were of good size and very clean, bedding changed daily if you want them to (put a little sign on the door), otherwise they just clean and make the bed with the same covers. Bathroom had a sizeable bathtub. Beds were very comfortable if you like them medium soft, and 2 extra pilows were available in the wardrobe. For a simple double room, we still got a table and two chairs (1 armchair, 1 at the desk) and still had enough room to stock several bags and move around with ease. The free safe in the room came in handy. The minibar was stocked daily at a steep price as usual. For 14 Euros per person per day (you can get a speacial for 7 Euros per person per day if you stay long enough) you get eggs made to your choice and either normal or local sausages or bacon and a contiental buffet breakfast that was absolutely perfect, a very large choice of breads, pasteries, juices, cereal, local cheese and meats. Overal, if you get the 7 Euro deal it's more than worth it. I was 5 months pregnant when we went there and definetly enjoyed. The pool, located in the hotel right across of the street, is tiny and has terrible timetables, unless you really don't want to go to the beach there is no reason to use it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, quiet close, to main rail and tour bus”
Reviews.Author: Parker1211
Reviews.Content: Great Mid sized Hotel. Staff was helpful, Package deal was a bargin, rooms were great, upgraded room with large private patio, great restaurants close by on Diagonal. Close to real shopping, in business area not tourist area so if you want to experience daily life in Barcelona, this is the place. Nice firm beds, not old and mushy.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay (for the fourth time), with very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ricsi01
Reviews.Content: good hotel with very good service. rooms are a bit simple and at the front can be a bit noisy. breakfast is allways a pleasure. very good location. we enjoyed this stay again very much.

Reviews.Title: “A real Derby from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Mantelstone
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Derby through Priceline and it was classified under 4 Star hotels/West Barcelona. Thus, we were expecting a classy hotel just outside the centre. However, this hotel is certainly not a 4 star, would rate it a 3 star; the hotel staff were reasonably friendly but the hotel itself looked fairly run down. The hotel must have been built many moons ago, and it probably never seen as much as a basic refurbishment ever since. We saw one of the standard rooms and were happy to be upgraded to a bigger room with a sauna!! The sauna did indeed compensate for a lot of the other shortcomings :) Staff was reasonably friendly but not more than usual for a hotel of this meagre calibre. Their "sister" hotel Gran Derby was supposed to host a fitness centre and a pool but the former was closed until further notice so there went any opportunity to get a good exercise before hitting downtown Barcelona. In terms of the hotel location, it is fairly close to the main shopping street (a very long street) in a quiet neighbourhood. There is a metro stop 10 min walk away (Hospital Clinic) which takes you to center of the town. We also walked all the way from the hotel to the marina but this took several hours (with well-needed restaurant breaks in between). If you expect a 4 star hotel you will be very disappointed but for a 3 star hotel it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ma_2508
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, the price is fair, and the rooms are excellent! Best things were the shower, the bed and the breakfast: all great surprises! It could me closer to the metro station, but 10 minutes walking never killed anyone. I would definitelly come back to Derby!

Reviews.Title: “Great central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidram1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 11 yr old son as a weekend break. The hotel is in a quiet street, 2 mins walk from the avenue diagonal - the main road through barca. It also has desinger shops etc along it. Th main Rambla's run off the avenue diagonal and so it was not more than 20-30 mins walk to get to the hub of things. The hotel has very comfortable aircon rooms. Apart from the minibar, there are no extras to pay for airocn, room safe. Breakfast is continental, but you can ask for eggs/bacon/sausage (incl in the breakfast price), but its not a "full english". The restaurant is small as is the hotel. Across the road is the Gran Derby (sister hotel) which has a sunbathing area and small pool (about 20ft x 10ft). When I was there there weren't many kids so the pool was not anywhere near crowded. As the pool is effectively on the roof, it is high up and for those with little kids, there wasn't a safely rail by one of the potential drops - just a few plant pots, so I had a minor panic when my son's ball went over and he was lening over to see where it was!. The reception staff all spoke english very well and were extremely helpful with local info re taxi's, buses etc. The only criticisms...no bin in the room other than tiny bathroom one (so easily filled with all the mags,papers etc taken on the plane!), and the bathroom tiles could do with regrouting. Overall for a weekend break this hotel is great, though prbably more suited to adult than families. For those wanting to see the impressive Nou camp, the local bus is 1 mins walk away and takes about 10mins to get there for E1.40 each - cheaper than tram or taxi. The city tour buses are also worth using...hop on/off system on set routes - E22 adults and multilingual commentary through including headsets. There is certainlyp plenty to do in Barca. Book excursion tickets from UK as they work out significantly cheaper than "at the gate" prices.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanmoore1981
Reviews.Content: great wee place to stay in barca as its clean, well looked after and friendly!!! has a pool (definate bonus as far from the beach) although you do have to cross the street to the sister hotel to use it, not a major prob but just a wee bit of a hassle. Great staff very helpful and generous!! rooms were ok, great value for money but do be aware that the hotel is about a 15 min walk to the nearest tube station and is not located near any attractions, again didnt bother us because we enjoyed the walk. dont think we will return to this hotel as it was just a little to far out the centre of barca, but please dont let this put you of staying here as it really was a comfortable and friendly stay ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great price!”
Reviews.Author: hayley101
Reviews.Content: Nice and very clean hotel at a good price. We didn’t have breakfast as the continental room service breakfast was nearly 20euro and we were not informed about breakfast in the restaurant when we checked in so I can’t comment on this. There didn’t seem to be soundproofing in rooms. We could hear the conversation of the people in the next room very clearly, furniture being dragged across the floor from upstairs, room doors closing and conversations in the hall were loud even though we had double doors into our room. This was our major gripe although we were only in the room mainly to sleep in the good sized comfortable beds. Room was cleaned every day with sheets changed every second day and most days we got a chocolate on our pillow, which was a nice touch. No outdoor space to relax in this hotel although you could use the Gran Derby Hotel pool across the road but this was a small area and only around 9 sunbeds which were all taken on the both occasions we tried. Free Internet available in the lobby on one computer which was handy. This hotel is in a good location but about 20 minutes walk from a metro so we used the excellent Barcelona bus service. Buses to everywhere in Barcelona and accommodated by stops all within 5 minutes of the hotel – fantastic (bus map is required for numbers and stops and can be from picked up from metro stations). We used the T10 ticket (10 journeys for 7.95euro – single journey 1.40euro) which you also get from metro stations and this allows travel on bus, metro and tram. Barcelona is not a city that takes too many credit cards. Take plenty of cash with you and if using cards then take your passport for ID. All in all I would recommend this hotel as it was a generally nice hotel at a nice price.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of amenities means this is not a 4 star hotel ALSO noisy at night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gaynie_10
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 day break with my mother. We were told that the hotel was local to attractions and that it was 4 * . On arriving I was surprised at the small reception area. The staff were friendly and we picked up out key to room 428. The trip upin the escalator was interesting as the door kept on closing on us as we were trying to go into it! We eventually got up tot he room and was pleased with this and the cleanliness was very good. The TV was a disappointment as there was only 2 English news channels although we were out most of the time so was happy to look over this. Having arrived early evening we decided to tke advantage of the hotels restaurant and bar. On reaching the reception downstairs however we reaslised that this was in fact shut and the restaurant only open for breakfast. We could see the bar from outside but this was locked off and not in use. We were told that there was a restaurant next door and that this was part of the hotel. We did venture into this but it was completely shut off from the hotel and did not feel like it was part of the hotel either. This restaurant was very casual with basic decor and dinner. It was not somewhere you could spend the evening or even longer than 1/2 hour as it did not have that feel to it. On day two we decided to venture into the city centre but were told that it was outside of walking distance. We were using the tour bus to get about or a taxi to get into the center. Taxis were however costing approx 10 euros per journey. in the evening we stayed local but found we were restricted in the amount of resturants and bars around. My main gripe with the hotel is how can it be classified as 4 * with a lack of available amenities. The second gripe I had was the noisy at night. We were in a front facing room so dont know if this made a difference. We had refuse collectors collecting rubbish throughout the small hours whilst we were trying to sleep and this was EVERY night. It was SO noisy. Bottles were being thrown around and at times it sounded like thunder as it was so noisy. the workers chatted loudly outside as they went about their duties too. I was waking up for breakfast so tired each morning!! Overall I would say that the plus side to the hotel is that it is very clean and the staff are nice. The location is however poor, noisy quality terrible and the hotel does not in my opinion contribute to a 4* Gaynor B

Reviews.Title: “"An interesting experience"”
Reviews.Author: Monica_Crest
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Derby Hotel after reading a few reviews...some of them were encouraging and others...daunting enough...but...we went and stayed there for about 8 days! I must say that it wasn't bad at all...pretty room, good services, nice staff, friendly people, quiet and very clean everywhere in the hotel...I think we were lucky because we didn't hear any noise from the building under construction across the street...just because people didn't work during that time...maybe it was too cold for that...anyway...the hotel looks like a peaceful place, very nice inside and well placed as a building! Our room, halls, the elevator, other places from the hotel were very clean and looked really nice! We felt very good there, anyway, and rooms have almost all you need to make you feel comfortable! Now I think it was a good choice, even if we had some doubts before getting there! It was an interesting experience and maybe next time we'll choose the same place to stay in Barcelona - one of my favorites european cities!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of noisy local construction”
Reviews.Author: UKBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel on 2 occasions and find it generally comfortable and clean. However on my recent stay (February 2010), there were very noisy building works underway on a large building across the street. Though I requested a very quiet room when checking in, I was given a room that was directly across the street from the construction, which commenced at 7:30am and lasted the whole day. So much for a quiet room. I got a good rate for this hotel (€55 per night) but don't think I will stay there again while the construction is going on.

Reviews.Title: “Other Guests Beware”
Reviews.Author: gillsped
Reviews.Content: although this was billed as 4 star 3 would be fairer. It was spotlessly clean but our stay was ruined when 150 Euros were stolen from the hotel safe in the room. The manager was helpful but insisted no-one could have taken it! records showed staff had entered the room no fewer than 6 times during our day out which he insisted was normal. In addition the bar in the hotel was closed and the TV channels advertised were not available. Would not return

Reviews.Title: “A lovely modern hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Marina107
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed this hotel from the helpful staff, to the modern, sleek decor and spacious rooms. The only drawback was it is a bit of a trek into the center of Barcelona. If your looking for a place right next to the action,then this is not the hotel for you. Granted, if at the end of a day of touring and walking you would like to retreat back to a nice quiet , relaxing place then Hotel Derby is for you. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good but the staff at the breakfast was horrible...”
Reviews.Author: lsheen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and quiet-which is A+. The location was very good as wel. It's only 10 minutes walk to the main trains. I had a bad experience with the staff who serve the breakfast. He was very mean and rude. I wanted to order some eggs which that is included for my package. He told me I had to pay for the egg for 6.30 Euro. Meanwhile he lets the other customer in other table order the eggs. I think that's very rude and not professional. I did report that to the lobby manager but they didn't really do anything about this. I was very upsad about this...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - just a couple of miles outside the city centre”
Reviews.Author: DoctorAndy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel marvellous. Very friendly and obliging staff. Also nice clean rooms! Really everything you could want for a nice holiday in Barcelona, with the exception of being about 2.5 miles out of the centre, But this just a €7 taxi ride away. The hotel is also located near a stop for the famous open top bus route, so one can use that as a means of transport. In the nroom is a nice tv, with a couple of channels in English. Breakfast is also available in the hotel, but this was rather expensive (€15). Easier to just go out and get something to eat nearby for a whole lot less money. I felt the staff, were in a class of their own. Very friendly, will do anything they can to help and possibly even part of the character of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel - long way from the tourist trail”
Reviews.Author: MackSussex_England
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this Hotel. Nice rooms, spacious, clean and well serviced. It is a little noisy in the Hotel, you can hear every door banging along the whole floor which is a little annoying if you are looking for a lie in. The coffee shop is nice, good coffee and great pastries. The location is far from the tourist spots, but the bus tours and metro are only a 10 min walk away. Little disturbing that a number of gentlemens clubs are right on the doorstep but to be fair they seemed discreet and no hassle even passing late at night. Overall nice business hotel, clean conveneint and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient hotel, but watch...”
Reviews.Author: susane07
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel was very efficient, clean, quiet and situated in a pleasant, residential neighborhood - far from the touristy, congested city center. We walked the routes to the famous sites and enjoyed other sights along the way. It is not necessary to take a taxi. The staff was always pleasant and helpful to us. There was a terrific shower. The hotel did not have much ambience, but who cares? My only qualm (which is major) with this hotel is that they did not explain that the buffet, continental breakfast was NOT included in the room price. For the cost of this breakfast, forgetaboutit. It is expensive and not worth participating in this hotel feature.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional boutique but miles from city center.”
Reviews.Author: penangnite
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Derby for three nights. First impression was that it is located in a quiet street and it is a modern looking boutique with wood panelling offset with black borders, a pattern repeated throughout. Reception is quite formal but checking in was straightforward. The standard room is quite basic but clean - wooden floors and panelling, with neutral colors makes it look quite sterile. Bathroom is functional, equipped with a Grohe shower system. Slightly more than the usual complementary toileries - mouthwash, conditioner, shampoo, shower gel, body milk. However, there are no coffee/tea making facilities, a frustrating inconvenience considering breakfast wasn't included and I was not willing to pay the €14 for breakfast. Housekeeping is good but the reception could easily have done better. While english is spoken, they messed up on the wake-up call service - twice and requested for the cab at the wrong time, in spite of me confirming with them on the times. I would have settled for a radio alarm clock in the room or at least a TV with a wake-up function. Other noteworthies: Location: Quiet street, not too far from the main streets of Sarria and Ave Diagonal. However, there appears to be two "men's bar" on the same street but in spite of this, the area feels like a safe neighborhood. Hotel is about 0.5km to the nearest Metro station of Hospital Clinic. To give you an idea of the distance to the the old town/Gothic Quarter etc, it would be at least a good 45 min walk. Overall, while the Derby may be clean and quiet, if you are looking for a central location, the Derby is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: Leebee9
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to give Derby Hotel a go anyway because we have always experienced some noise in hotel rooms in big cities in Europe, but this place was the WORST we have ever experienced. The noise either kept us awake at night, or woke us up when we finally got to sleep. The noise was not only from the street outside (which is actually a nice residential street), but also constant noise from the uncarpeted corridors and also there is a lack of soundproofing between the rooms. The fact that the hotel was quite removed from the main sights and public transport and that the staff were not friendly only compounded our disappointment during our stay. On the positive side, the rooms were clean and the hotel was in great condition.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GREAT FOR A FOUR STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mazter
Reviews.Content: we recently returned from staying at this hotel. First impressions on arrival were very pleasing, there was my wife and i, plus our 1 year old child. I booked this hotel from their own website, so i saved £££ they even provided a cot for our baby. The rooms were clean and well looked after. Apart from the mini bar, lcd tv and the hair dryer there was nothing else! I was hoping they had a kettle and a iron in the room. One of the reasons i wanted a kettle was to warm my childs food up. Every time i wanted hot water i had to ring room service, which would take time to bring the water. After a day or so, room service started to charge for hot water (€3) which i thought was nuts!! We used the pool which was across the road at the Grand Derby Hotel, which was fine, but the water in the pool was freezing and the lack of towels was amazing, considering there was only 3 other people there! Breakfast was brilliant and generally staff were pleasant! Personally i would not class this as a 4 Star Hotel. It would be useful to learn Spanish, as non of the house keeping staff did not speak English!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: CK2046
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay in Barcelona at a last minute bargain price. We weren't too sure what the hotel would be like, as is often the case with last minute deals! However we were very happy with what we got! Our first impression as we arrived was of a hotel that was smart clean, and possibly under other circumstances out of our price range (although I can't remember figures now, I am sure the normal rates aren't too bad). As you can imagine we were pleased with our bargain. The rooms were immaculate - our only complaint being that the previous guest had used the mini bar and the half full bottle of gin that they had used was sitting in the fridge when we arrived. Other than that, no complaints whatsoever. We only ate breakfast at the hotel on the first morning, after that it was out and about grabbing food on the go! It was lovely though and perhaps had we not been so keen to take in all the sites we may have had breakfast there more often. There is no pool at the Derby, but you can use the pool across the road at the Grand Derby. It is a very small pool though, and overlooked by apartments on all sides. We only used is once, but this was not really an issue for us as we didn't go to Barcelona to lounge by a pool! All in all a really nice place to stay, the only off putting thing were the random sculptures in the foyer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lelouuk
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY!! Rooms are lovely, with a HUGE bath which is nice to soak in after all the walking we did. If you're after a room with a nice view, this is NOT the hotel for you as it's in the middle of a residential area. Only negative is that you have a 15/20min walk to the nearest metro station BUT it doesn't take very long to get into the main city centre hustle/bustle areas. A cute little cafe is next door serving light snack in the morning which is nice if you don't require a 'breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Agree that this is not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: travelling81271
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as you would expect for a 3 star class. Rooms are clean, but beware of the noise if you are on the road side (there are a few bars/restaurants in the street and a bottle recyling bin which doesnt help with noise control!) Location is about 20min walk to La Ramblas...7€ taxi ride. Breakfast is good but not worth the 14€

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: janeye
Reviews.Content: At the most this hotel is a superior 2 star. There are very little tourist leaflets or information on the stand in the hotel or at the Gran Derby across the road. The staff are non communicative even when spoken to. Unless you have booked a superior room, you have to ask for a CD player. I would recommend booking a superior room if there are 2 of you. The standard double rooms are very small. Ask for a room on the 7th floor as they all have a private terrace with table and chairs and the rooms are larger. Room service meals are good value and decent sized portions but not a great deal of choice. The cafe next door (which is part of the hotel) only displays their menu in Spanish and doesn't give prices, so beware. The pool at the Gran Derby is about a quarter of the size of a normal pool and there are only 8 loungers and a table and 4 chairs so get there early at the height of the season. The hotel is a 25 minute walk from La Ramblas. On the plus side, the toiletries are nice.
